head.supplied: Phillip Island ¶ 28/1/63. ¶ Dear Mr Tulk. ¶ ¶ During my short stay in Melbourne I had not leisure enough to acknowledge the receipt of the 3 vol. of the Navara Exped., which I found at my house when ...

div.p: VPRS 5486/P0/2, no. 57 inward correspondence — official letters, VA 928 Melbourne Public Library, Public Record Office, Victoria.

To proof. p/cs by TD.
Phillip Island
Vic.

During my short stay in Melbourne I had not leisure enough to acknowledge the receipt of the 3 vol. of the Navara Exped., which I found at my house when returning from the Snowy mountains, and for the transmission of which I owe you my best thanks. Sir Redmond Barry was so friendly to send me the Library Catalogue & Exhibition Essays through your hand most elegantly bound.

Pray give Sir Redmond on his return my kindest regard & inform him, that I shall wait on him & bring the volume in which the plant dedicated to him has been inserted. Mr President Bentham has introduced the plants also into the 1 vol of the Australian flora now under the press in London.
